organizational-unit:properties.prop:name: Projekt X
organizational-unit:properties.prop:description: The Projekt X was established in 2006 in order to create the first research centre concerning the questions "What is Projekt X?" and "How should an affiliation with more than one parent be handled?". Researchers of Projekt X use the wide experiences of MPIWG and IPP to provide versatile answers.

organizationalunit:organizational-unit.dc:title: Projekt X
organizationalunit:organizational-unit.dc:description: The Projekt X was established in 2006 in order to create the first research centre concerning the questions "What is Projekt X?" and "How should an affiliation with more than one parent be handled?". Researchers of Projekt X use the wide experiences of MPIWG and IPP to provide versatile answers.

organizational-unit:properties.prop:name: Work group for tropical ecology
organizational-unit:properties.prop:description: The working group concentrates its research on the ecology of floodplains, with special emphasis on the floodplains of the Amazon River (Várzea) and the Negro River (Igapó) near Manaus.

organizationalunit:organizational-unit.dc:title: Work group for tropical ecology
organizationalunit:organizational-unit.dc:description: The working group concentrates its research on the ecology of floodplains, with special emphasis on the floodplains of the Amazon River (Várzea) and the Negro River (Igapó) near Manaus.

organizational-unit:properties.prop:name: Research Group Solid State NMR
organizational-unit:properties.prop:description: We develop and apply NMR techniques specifically designed for the study of solid-phase systems that allow for the determination of complete structural arrangements in membrane proteins, protein fibrils and other (bio)molecules.

organizationalunit:organizational-unit.dc:title: Research Group Solid State NMR
organizationalunit:organizational-unit.dc:description: We develop and apply NMR techniques specifically designed for the study of solid-phase systems that allow for the determination of complete structural arrangements in membrane proteins, protein fibrils and other (bio)molecules.

organizational-unit:properties.prop:name: MPI for limnology
organizational-unit:properties.prop:description: The Max Planck Institute for Limnology performs ecological research on inland waters. It has presently two departments and two independent research groups, which encompass the fields of evolutionary ecology, physiological ecology, stream ecology, and tropical ecology at the land-water interface of large rivers in Brazil.

organizationalunit:organizational-unit.dc:title: MPI for limnology
organizationalunit:organizational-unit.dc:description: The Max Planck Institute for Limnology performs ecological research on inland waters. It has presently two departments and two independent research groups, which encompass the fields of evolutionary ecology, physiological ecology, stream ecology, and tropical ecology at the land-water interface of large rivers in Brazil.

organizational-unit:properties.prop:name: MPI for the History of Science
organizational-unit:properties.prop:description: The Max Planck Institute for the History of Science in Berlin was established in 1994 in order to create an international research center for the history of science in Germany. Researchers at the Institute investigate how new categories of thought, proof, and experience have emerged in the centuries-long interaction between the sciences and their ambient cultures.

organizationalunit:organizational-unit.dc:title: MPI for the History of Science
organizationalunit:organizational-unit.dc:description: The Max Planck Institute for the History of Science in Berlin was established in 1994 in order to create an international research center for the history of science in Germany. Researchers at the Institute investigate how new categories of thought, proof, and experience have emerged in the centuries-long interaction between the sciences and their ambient cultures.

organizational-unit:properties.prop:name: MPI für Plasmaphysik
organizational-unit:properties.prop:description: The research conducted at Max-Planck-Institut für Plasmaphysik (IPP) in Garching and Greifswald is concerned with investigating the physical basis of a fusion power plant. Like the sun, such a plant is to generate energy from fusion of atomic nuclei. With its workforce of approx. 1.000 IPP is one of the largest fusion research centres in Europe.

organizationalunit:organizational-unit.dc:title: MPI für Plasmaphysik
organizationalunit:organizational-unit.dc:description: The research conducted at Max-Planck-Institut für Plasmaphysik (IPP) in Garching and Greifswald is concerned with investigating the physical basis of a fusion power plant. Like the sun, such a plant is to generate energy from fusion of atomic nuclei. With its workforce of approx. 1.000 IPP is one of the largest fusion research centres in Europe.

organizational-unit:properties.prop:name: Department 1 - Structural Changes in Systems of Knowledge
organizational-unit:properties.prop:description: The work of the research group is dedicated to understanding the historical processes of structural changes in systems of knowledge. This goal comprises the reconstruction of central cognitive structures of scientific thinking, the study of the dependence of these structures on their experiential basis and on their cultural conditions, and the study of the interaction between individual thinking and institutionalized systems of knowledge. This theoretical program of an historical epistemology is the common core of the different investigations and research projects pursued and planned by the research group.

organizationalunit:organizational-unit.dc:title: Department 1 - Structural Changes in Systems of Knowledge
organizationalunit:organizational-unit.dc:description: The work of the research group is dedicated to understanding the historical processes of structural changes in systems of knowledge. This goal comprises the reconstruction of central cognitive structures of scientific thinking, the study of the dependence of these structures on their experiential basis and on their cultural conditions, and the study of the interaction between individual thinking and institutionalized systems of knowledge. This theoretical program of an historical epistemology is the common core of the different investigations and research projects pursued and planned by the research group.

organizational-unit:properties.prop:name: Department Research and Development
organizational-unit:properties.prop:description: The department for Research and Development will research and develop.

organizationalunit:organizational-unit.dc:title: Department Research and Development
organizationalunit:organizational-unit.dc:description: The department for Research and Development will research and develop.

organizational-unit:properties.prop:name: ASDEX Upgrade
organizational-unit:properties.prop:description: The ASDEX Upgrade tokamak (Axially Symmetric Divertor EXperiment) went into operation at Garching in 1990. This fusion device, Germany's largest at present, is for investigating crucial problems in fusion research under reactor-like conditions.

organizationalunit:organizational-unit.dc:title: ASDEX Upgrade
organizationalunit:organizational-unit.dc:description: The ASDEX Upgrade tokamak (Axially Symmetric Divertor EXperiment) went into operation at Garching in 1990. This fusion device, Germany's largest at present, is for investigating crucial problems in fusion research under reactor-like conditions.

organizational-unit:properties.prop:name: MPI for biophysical chemistry
organizational-unit:properties.prop:description: The Max Planck Institute for Biophysical Chemistry (Karl Friedrich Bonhoeffer Institute) was created in 1971 through the merger of two Max Planck Institutes in Göttingen, the Institute for Physical Chemistry and the Institute for Spectroscopy. It has since undergone a continuous evolution manifested by an expanding range of core subjects and work areas.

organizationalunit:organizational-unit.dc:title: MPI for biophysical chemistry
organizationalunit:organizational-unit.dc:description: The Max Planck Institute for Biophysical Chemistry (Karl Friedrich Bonhoeffer Institute) was created in 1971 through the merger of two Max Planck Institutes in Göttingen, the Institute for Physical Chemistry and the Institute for Spectroscopy. It has since undergone a continuous evolution manifested by an expanding range of core subjects and work areas.

organizational-unit:properties.prop:name: Department Genes and behavior
organizational-unit:properties.prop:description: The Department Genes and Behavior investigates in the mouse the dynamic interplay between gene expression, development and behavior.

organizationalunit:organizational-unit.dc:title: Department Genes and behavior
organizationalunit:organizational-unit.dc:description: The Department Genes and Behavior investigates in the mouse the dynamic interplay between gene expression, development and behavior.

organizational-unit:properties.prop:name: Max Planck Society
organizational-unit:properties.prop:description: The Max Planck Society for the Advancement of Science is an independent, non-profit research organization that primarily promotes and supports research at its own institutes.

organizationalunit:organizational-unit.dc:title: Max Planck Society
organizationalunit:organizational-unit.dc:description: The Max Planck Society for the Advancement of Science is an independent, non-profit research organization that primarily promotes and supports research at its own institutes.

organizational-unit:properties.prop:name: Department of evolutionary ecology
organizational-unit:properties.prop:description: Coevolution in host-parasite systems; sexual selection; evolution of mate choice: fitness consequences of mate choice for immunocompetence and virulence; life-history strategies; population genetics of host-parasite systems; evolution of complex parasite life cycles; strategies in the hermaphrodite´s dilemma; predator-prey interactions; evolutionary ecology of competition; cooperation in the prisoner?s dilemma.

organizationalunit:organizational-unit.dc:description: Coevolution in host-parasite systems; sexual selection; evolution of mate choice: fitness consequences of mate choice for immunocompetence and virulence; life-history strategies; population genetics of host-parasite systems; evolution of complex parasite life cycles; strategies in the hermaphrodite´s dilemma; predator-prey interactions; evolutionary ecology of competition; cooperation in the prisoner?s dilemma.

organizational-unit:properties.prop:name: Max Planck Digital Library
organizational-unit:properties.prop:description: The Max Planck Digital Library (MPDL) is currently in the foundation process and will be a new central scientific service unit within the Max Planck Society (MPS) responsible for the strategic planning, development and operation of the digital infrastructures necessary for providing the institutes with scientific information and for supporting web-based scholarly communication.

organizationalunit:organizational-unit.dc:title: Max Planck Digital Library

organizational-unit:properties.prop:description: Independent research group on digital editions.
